entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:26AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...TRACE ASHFALL POSSIBLE FOR THE ALASKA PENINSULA THIS MORNING... As of 0400 AM this morning, satellite imagery indicates that an eruption has occurred at Shishaldin Volcano. Ash lofted by an eruption is expected to travel northeast of the volcano and may lead to trace amounts of ashfall at the surface. This statement will be updated if conditions change.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Alaska Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:15AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: Showers and thunderstorms continue across portions of the northern slopes of the Alaska Range. Radar estimates over the last 24 hours indicate that an additional 0.5 to 1.0 with localized amounts of up to 2 inches of rain have fallen in the northern slopes of the Alaska Range. entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley
